answers.answer: Patches are difficult to taper from so I assume you will have to go ct. I think your best bet is to speak with your doctor and ask him for a safe taper plan. that will get you through the physical withdrawal.As far as the blood sugar goes, you should also speak with your doctor. I don't think anyone here can help you with a medical problem such as that. there is also a good diabetes forum here at MedHelp. You may want to post there and get some feedback but again, you should consult with your doctor.

I was on 10 m Norspan patches.  The first time I went off of it - I went from 10m to 5m - I was miserable!  Anxiety was very bad and flu like symptoms.  My doctor prescribed Valium which help - and stopped me from crying all the time.  When I went off the 5m patch - I cut a small bit off every week until I was down to about 1m.  I did not have withdrawal symptoms by cutting the patches over a few weeks.  If the patch started to come off - I just covered it with tape or a band aid.  There is no point going CT - just gradually reduce your dosage.
